column1: What will be the US domestic box office gross in the opening weekend for Avatar: The Way of Water, according to Box Office Mojo?
column5: ['Less than $100 million', 'Between $100 million and $150 million, inclusive', 'More than $150 million but less than $200 million', 'Between $200 million and $250 million, inclusive', 'More than $250 million']
column6: ['Business', 'Entertainment']
Just went to see the film and... the theater was not full...
Thursday night numbers can in at just shy of 17million. Slightly behind The Batman (Thursday numbers was 17.6 million) / Batman opening weekend was 128 million

Putting more weight in bin 2, after @gregkroleski's rationale below and prediction markets' pessimism (probability of > 175M currently a mere 3%: https://polymarket.com/event/will-avatar-the-way-of-water-gross-more-than-175-million-domestically-on-its-opening-weekend )

Opening night was apparently $17M (https://www.cnbc.com/2022/12/16/avatar-the-way-of-water-thursday-box-office.html) - which is closer to what Batman did (finished the weekend at $134M) and much less than what Black Panther 2 did ($28 on opening night and ended weekend at $181 - https://www.msn.com/en-us/movies/news/black-panther-2-opening-night-box-office-tops-original-movie/ar-AA140ZPm) Jurassic World did $18M on Thursday and $145 on the weekend.

Arcing downward and increasing to the norm. Have dropped both top and bottom. Also shrank expectation to 180-200M.

> "Already, “Avatar 2” has drummed up $38 million in advance ticket sales, pacing ahead of “Top Gun: Maverick” (which opened to $126 million) and “Jurassic World Dominion” (which opened to $145 million), but behind “Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness” (which opened to $181 million) and “Black Panther Wakanda Forever” (which opened to $180 million) at the same point in their sale cycles."
Confirming & strengthening my earlier projection

Rotten Tomatoes at 84 (so far) https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/avatar_the_way_of_water which is in the 75-95 range I'd expected but below the 87-92 I had mapped the reviews I'd read to. I'm going to taper my forecast a bit based on that.
Read some of the reviews that went from very positive to trying too hard meh. I have dropped my 250+ down to negligible and still think it will be between 195-210M
Embargo was lifted, just as I forecast yesterday!
Updating based on the following:
Adjusting upward because:
Updated news seems to be leaning towards 150-180 million

Bumping up a bit based on forecasts of others. Still waiting for the Rotten Tomato score - I suspect it will be in the 75-95 range and would guess 87-92. I think that number means a lot these days and it might mean even more for viewers, like me, that remember the first one as technically sound but content-light. A strong RT score will likely move a large chunk of the movable middle to actually go to the theaters.

Going off of the top Gross Weekends of the Year in 2022 and comparing the titles/genres on Box Office Mojo. The original Avatar was a huge hit, but I don't think the movie aged well and people aren't that interested in it as they are the Marvel movies, like the top weekend grossing movie Thor: Love and Thunder. I think it'll be significantly below the ~$230,000,000 the Marvel movie earned. I'm going to guess $170 MM.

Polymarket implied probability for gross opening > 175M has just jumped to 64% (from 53%): https://polymarket.com/market/will-avatar-the-way-of-water-gross-more-than-175-million-domestically-on-its-opening-weekend
Adjusting upwards seeing the promo and marketing strategy. Appears likely effective

BoxOffice Pro has an updated estimation today at 167-192 M (up from 150-180 M on Dec 2): https://www.boxofficepro.com/long-range-box-office-forecast-blumhouses-m3gan-tracking-for-a-solid-2023-lead-off-plus-the-latest-avatar-the-way-of-water-projections/

Adjusting up significantly based on VERY positive initial critical reviews.
wip

The movie reviews seem to be pretty good. Found another report forecasting 150-175m. So I will increase significantly the probability for that bucket, still leaving room for lower numbers as Thanksgiving movie season seemed weak.
Critics' first reactions, released yesterday, have been extremely positive

On the other hand, people seem to agree that the story is much stronger in the Avatar sequel than the original Avatar in 2009. Further, the 3D aspect may boost its relative performance to Dr. Strange 2 and Black Panther 2, which are not necessarily made with 3D as a significant element in the moviegoing experience. You also have the advantage of Avatar 2 premiering in a month that typically have high grossing movies, and you have the advantage of it being a relatively more family friendly appeal compared to the horror vibes in Dr. Strange 2 and the somber vibes in Black Panther 2.I also think in your first sentence, this realization should cause you to maintain your 3rd forecast at the minimum, not fall back to the lower-value bins. I would have adjusted ever so slightly closer to the estimates of those using the "wrong prior" as opposed to against it. To forecast bin 2 would say Avatar 2 is going to underperform Dr. Strange 2 and Black Panther 2 by at least 18%.

Moving down a bit as I think the forecasts are using the wrong prior (Black Panther and Dr. Strange) which have much bigger followings and big recent prequels. For me to go more confident I'd need to see the Rotten Tomatoes score >75% and I'd need to hear more about how the visuals were groundbreaking. From what I recall with the 2009 film, we all went to see it not because the story was amazing (lots of folks said it was just a ripoff of FernGully, Pocahontas or Last of the Mohicans) but because the visuals were stunning - it was one of the first big 3D IMAX movies that really made that technology worth it. I'm not sure there is a similar technology change to justify this and the chance of a sequel having a better story than the original is pretty low (Empire Strikes Back, Godfather II, Mad Max... anything else?)
150-170 million seems to be where most projections are leaning right now - https://www.thewrap.com/avatar-way-of-water-box-office-prediction/

Rationale:
@probahilliby So, here was my logic. Disparate, but in a way connected elements
Most range estimates are between 150-170M
HT @kevins for checking the past accuracy of https://www.boxofficepro.com/category/forecasts-tracking/

I'm mostly using Black Panther WF as a reference point. I visualized a scatterplot of weekend opening grosses and came up with an informed plausible range, then looked primarily at Black Panther WF as the closest comparison class and looked at a plausible range relative to that mindful to account for a reasonable error difference between Black Panther WF and Avatar 2. Based on word of mouth in my personal life, I'm expecting Avatar 2 to come close to the Black Panther 2 figure; it could quite reasonably overshoot Black Panther WF.

https://www.boxofficepro.com/category/forecasts-tracking/ - this site seems to be pretty good at estimating the opening weekend take. I have absolutely no idea how they make these forecasts, but I took a sample of the last ~10 weekend forecasts made and a few long range ones too. The ranges they provide are pretty big, but the actual opening almost always falls inside the range provided. It sometimes falls slightly outside but really not by much in any case. If the website made the data easier to access rather than painstakingly going through to each article and looking for the forecasts, then I would be able to do more detailed analysis.
